p: Since December 2019, the world is facing a new humanitarian emergency due to a novel corona virus – severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). This virus has caused a global outbreak of coronavirus disease COVID-19, which is characterized by severe progressive pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.[ 1] At present, there is no effective therapy for COVID-19. Diverse therapies that include but not limited to lopinavir–ritonavir, remdesivir, danoprevir, darunavir–cobicistat, ribavirin and interferon beta, chloroquine, hydroxychloroquine, oseltamivir, umifenovir, pirfenidone, bevacizumab, fingolimod, carrimycin, corticosteroids, losartan, tetrandrine, aviptadil, thalidomide, sarilumab, mesenchymal stem cells, and vaccines are undergoing clinical trials (clinicaltrials.gov search March 21, 2020) or have been suggested for use based on limited evidence.
